content.description: Oil is being pumped continuously from a certain oil well at a rate proportional to the amount of oil left in the well; that is,dy/dt=ky , where y is the amount of oil left in the well at any time t. Initially there were 1,000,000 gallons of oil in the well, and 6 years later there were 500,000 gallons remaining. It will no longer be profitable to pump oil when there are fewer than 50,000 gallons remaining.
content.question: At what rate is the amount of oil in the well decreasing when there are 600,000 gallons of oil remaining?

frqParts.text: At what rate is the amount of oil in the well decreasing when there are 600,000 gallons of oil remaining?

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
